results.title: Cultural Development of Australia
results.brief_description:
This short film depicts the enrichening of Australian food and cuture through the immigration and culural exchange of other races and creeds.

An animated short entered to “Create a Stamp Story” section of ACMI’s ‘Screen It’ media making competition for Primary Schools.

results.title: Cultural conflict
results.creator_credit: David Zweck and Country Education Project
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “English for H.S.C. students”.
A program of interviews and discussions led by Peter Couchman. The texts “Mister Johnson” (Joyce Carey), “The Inheritors” (William Golding), “A Place Apart” (Dervla Murphy) and “The Immigrants” (Wendy Lowenstein and Morag Loh) are considered in examining the causes of cultural conflict, how people are affected by it, how conflict can both enrich and impoverish individuals and communities and how conflict is resolved. Also appearing are Dr. M. McLaughlin and Charles D’Aprano.

results.title: Cults: choice or coercion
results.brief_description: Explores the legal, moral and emotional questions raised by contemporary cults. A young man who was indoctrinated into the Unification Church (Moonies) explains inside workings of the cult, and their parents give an account of the intervention and “deprogramming” of their son. Supplemented by interviews with Dr. Margaret Singer, who has done extensive research on cults and mind control.

results.title: Culloden [B&W] (TEFC)
results.creator_credit: Peter Watkins and British Broadcasting Corporation
results.brief_description: A dramatic reconstruction of the Battle of Culloden, fought in 1746 between the Scottish Jacobites and an English force led by the Duke of Cumberland. In this film, the director utilises a television reportage style to recreate and analyse the battle.

results.title: Cullens Lake
results.creator_credit: David Corke and Victorian Field and Game Association
results.brief_description:
Episode number 1 of Series “Wetlands of Victoria”.
Cullens Lake is near Kerang in Victoria and provides an ideal habitat for many different varieties of water birds. It also provides a drought relief area for water birds that are forced to leave their usual habitat of inland rivers. This film looks at the lake and the birds that use it. Examines the threat to the lake by plans of the State Rivers and Water Commission of Victoria to turn it into a salinity basin. Suitable for middle and upper secondary levels.

results.title: Culinary Herbs
results.brief_description: An interesting look at different herbs, cultivation, and preservation techniques, and how to use them in the kitchen. “A delightful film that has much to interest young and old who enjoy cooking.” - Landers Film Review.

results.title: Cul-de-Sac
results.creator_credit: Roman Polanski, Gene Gutowski and Compton
results.brief_description: Two wounded gangsters on the run descend upon a retired businessman living like a hermit with his young, bored and flirtatious French wife in an old castle on Holy Island, off the Northumberland coast. The arrival of the gangsters disrupts the couple’s eccentric relationship. (Awards: Winner of the Golden Bear at the Berlin Film Festival, 1966) Cast includes Donald Pleasence, Francoise Dorleac, Jacqueline Bisset, Lionel Stander and Jack MacGowran.

results.title: Cuckoo, Mr. Edgar!
results.creator_credit: Pierre M Trudeau, Therese Descary and National Film Board of Canada
results.brief_description: One mid-Spring evening at midnight, a cuckoo bird is struck by lightning and thrown from his perch to the ground. In the morning when the storm has cleared, he makes his way back up the tree to discover that his comfortable and tidy home has been filled with three unhatched eggs. Pretty soon the eggs have hatched and in their place emerge three young live chicks that become his surrogate. The life of the routinely organised bird is thrown into disarray as his affection for the three grows. A delightful animated tale for children about the pleasures of parenting. Voice provided by A. J. Henderson. Original music by Louis Gagne.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Pierre M Trudeau, Therese Descary and National Film Board of Canada
